subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Islanders center Mike Sillinger said he was retiring after 17 years in the N.H.L. because of an injured left hip. Sillinger, 38, played only seven games last season and had surgery in January. In February 2008, a procedure on the hip forced him to miss the final 29 games of that season. He played for a record 12 teams during his 17 seasons, three of which were with the Islanders.
